key_title: Key to the subspecies of Stipa rudis

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the species of Stipa

source.author: Walsh, N.G.
source.title: Poaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons
source.citation: From: Walsh, N.G. (1994). Poaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Awn less than 65 mm long, column less than 30 mm long, lemma 7–10 mm long; lower glume usually narrowly truncate
Awn 60–90 mm long, column 32–45 mm long; lemma 8.6–11.5 mm long; glumes broadly obtuse with 1–2 mm of delicately membranous, often erose tip, upper glume 11–14.5 mm long

Callus 0.8–1.7 mm long, usually less than 20% the length of the lemma; column less than 20 mm long; upper glume firm at the tip, 7–10 mm long; hairs of lemma often extending to apex and exserted as a sparse coma to 1 mm long
Callus 1.5–2.5 mm long, usually more than 20% the length of the lemma; column 20–25 mm long; upper glume membranous at the tip, 9–12.5 mm long; hairs of lemma not extending to apex of lemma
